metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24439 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
All versions of package gitpython are vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE) due to improper user input validation, which makes it possible to inject a maliciously crafted remote URL into the clone command. Exploiting this vulnerability is possible because the library makes external calls to git without sufficient sanitization of input arguments.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-git - 0.3.2~RC1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-git package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.2~RC1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
